title: Strategies for Applying Personalized System of Instruction (PSI) in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Instructional Design Theory and Higher Education Administration Experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing curriculum design competencies in social studies for practicing professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four stages of the PSI (Personalized System of Instruction) model (goal setting, self-directed learning, assessment, feedback) to design learning modules tailored to three learner types (e.g., beginner/intermediate/advanced) and achieve over 80% suitability in peer evaluation and expert review.

Learners can analyze progress data of 10 learners from public educational institutions within one week, draft a plan for applying a three-stage (initial/intermediate/completion) self-paced progress management system, and submit a final report incorporating at least two peer feedbacks.

Learners can design three or more feedback items using formative assessment tools (e.g., Google Forms, Kahoot!) within one week and operate a feedback system that receives over 80% suitability ratings through peer review and expert validation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
